body:
Comment 1: 
I think this is working as intended.
When expressions appear inside bigger
expressions (like when 5 * *s appears
in an argument to a function), they get
shrunk down a bit so that the overall
precedences are clear, like in x + y*z.
This is no different.

If you think a particular expression is not
clear, the fix doesn't have to involve changing
gofmt.  A more precise, limited fix would be to
add parentheses to the occasional expression
that is clearer with them: 5*(*s) or -5*(-*s).

Russ
